page.title: 08LYDE FARM
page.content: LYDE FARM. Lyde Farm consists of 275 acres.Most of the land is used for grazing Frisian cattle as it is a dairy farm with 110 cows and 85 beef cattle. The average cost of a cow is Â£500-600. The farmer goes to market in Chippenham once a week to buy or sell.Crops include wheat,barley,oats and maize and some fields are used for silage crops.The soil is a heavy clay with a Ph value of 8 and is limed once every 5 years .There are five workers on the farm including the owner and they have two cow dogs to help them round up the cattle.There are four tractors on the farm.
